verses.verse: <S%H1984>Boast<s%> not yourself of to <S%H4279>morrow<s%>; for you <S%H3045>know<s%> not what a <S%H3117>day<s%> may bring <S%H3205>forth<s%>.
Let another <S%H2114>man<s%> <S%H1984>praise<s%> <S%H6310>you<s%>, and not your own mouth; a <S%H5237>stranger<s%>, and not your own <S%H8193>lips<s%>.
A <S%H68>stone<s%> is <S%H3514>heavy<s%>, and the <S%H2344>sand<s%> <S%H5192>weighty<s%>; but a <S%H191>fool<s%>'s <S%H3708>wrath<s%> is <S%H3515>heavier<s%> than them <S%H8147>both<s%>.
<S%H2534>Wrath<s%> is <S%H395>cruel<s%>, and <S%H639>anger<s%> is <S%H7858>outrageous<s%>; but who is able to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H7068>envy<s%>?
<S%H1540>Open<s%> <S%H8433>rebuke<s%> is <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H5641>secret<s%> <S%H160>love<s%>.
<S%H539>Faithful<s%> are the <S%H6482>wounds<s%> of a <S%H157>friend<s%>; but the <S%H5390>kisses<s%> of a <S%H8130>enemy<s%> are <S%H6280>deceitful<s%>.
The <S%H7649>full<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H947>loathes<s%> a <S%H5317>honeycomb<s%>; but to the <S%H7457>hungry<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> every bitter <S%H4751>thing<s%> is <S%H4966>sweet<s%>.
As a <S%H6833>bird<s%> that <S%H5074>wanders<s%> from her <S%H7064>nest<s%>, so is a <S%H376>man<s%> that <S%H5074>wanders<s%> from his <S%H4725>place<s%>.

<S%H8081>Ointment<s%> and <S%H7004>perfume<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> the <S%H3820>heart<s%>: so does the <S%H4986>sweetness<s%> of a <S%H7453>man<s%>'s friend by <S%H5315>hearty<s%> <S%H6098>counsel<s%>.

Your own <S%H7453>friend<s%>, and your <S%H1>father<s%>'s <S%H7453>friend<s%>, <S%H5800>forsake<s%> <S%H935>not<s%>; neither go into your <S%H251>brother<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of your <S%H343>calamity<s%>: for <S%H2896>better<s%> is a <S%H7934>neighbor<s%> that is <S%H7138>near<s%> than a <S%H251>brother<s%> far <S%H7350>off<s%>.
My <S%H1121>son<s%>, be <S%H2449>wise<s%>, and make my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H8055>glad<s%>, that I may <S%H7725>answer<s%> him that blasphemes <S%H2778>me<s%>.
A <S%H6175>prudent<s%> man <S%H7200>foresees<s%> the <S%H7451>evil<s%>, and <S%H5641>hides<s%> <S%H6612>himself<s%>; but the simple pass <S%H5674>on<s%>, and are <S%H6064>punished<s%>.
<S%H3947>Take<s%> his <S%H899>garment<s%> that is <S%H6148>collateral<s%> for a <S%H2114>stranger<s%>, and take a <S%H2254>pledge<s%> of him for a strange <S%H5237>woman<s%>.

He that <S%H1288>blesses<s%> his <S%H7453>friend<s%> with a <S%H1419>loud<s%> <S%H6963>voice<s%>, rising <S%H7925>early<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>, it shall be <S%H2803>counted<s%> a curse to <S%H7045>him<s%>.
A <S%H2956>continual<s%> <S%H1812>dropping<s%> in a very <S%H5464>rainy<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> and a <S%H4079>contentious<s%> <S%H802>woman<s%> are <S%H7737>alike<s%>.
Whoever <S%H6845>hides<s%> her <S%H6845>hides<s%> the <S%H7307>wind<s%>, and the <S%H8081>ointment<s%> of his right <S%H3225>hand<s%>, which betrays <S%H7121>itself<s%>.
<S%H1270>Iron<s%> <S%H2300>sharpens<s%> <S%H1270>iron<s%>; so a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2300>sharpens<s%> the <S%H6440>favor<s%> of his <S%H7453>friend<s%>.
Whoever <S%H5341>keeps<s%> the fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> shall <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> <S%H8104>there<s%>: so he that waits on his <S%H113>master<s%> shall be <S%H3513>honored<s%>.
As in <S%H4325>water<s%> <S%H6440>face<s%> answers to <S%H6440>face<s%>, so the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> to <S%H120>man<s%>.
<S%H7585>Hell<s%> and <S%H11>destruction<s%> are <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H7646>full<s%>; so the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> are never <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>.
As the refining <S%H4715>pot<s%> for <S%H3701>silver<s%>, and the <S%H3564>furnace<s%> for <S%H2091>gold<s%>; so is a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H6310>to<s%> his <S%H4110>praise<s%>.

Though you should <S%H3806>pound<s%> a <S%H191>fool<s%> in a <S%H4388>mortar<s%> <S%H8432>among<s%> <S%H7383>wheat<s%> with a <S%H5940>pestle<s%>, yet will not his <S%H200>foolishness<s%> depart from <S%H5493>him<s%>.
Be you <S%H3045>diligent<s%> to <S%H3045>know<s%> the <S%H6440>state<s%> of your <S%H6629>flocks<s%>, and <S%H7896>look<s%> <S%H3820>well<s%> to your <S%H5739>herds<s%>.
For <S%H2633>riches<s%> are not for <S%H5769>ever<s%>: and does the <S%H5145>crown<s%> endure to <S%H1755>every<s%> <S%H1755>generation<s%>?
The <S%H2682>hay<s%> <S%H1540>appears<s%>, and the tender <S%H1877>grass<s%> <S%H7200>shows<s%> <S%H6212>itself<s%>, and herbs of the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> are <S%H622>gathered<s%>.
The <S%H3532>lambs<s%> are for your <S%H3830>clothing<s%>, and the <S%H6260>goats<s%> are the <S%H4242>price<s%> of the <S%H7704>field<s%>.

And you shall have <S%H5795>goats<s%>' <S%H2461>milk<s%> <S%H1767>enough<s%> for your <S%H3899>food<s%>, for the <S%H3899>food<s%> of your <S%H1004>household<s%>, and for the <S%H2416>maintenance<s%> for your <S%H5291>maidens<s%>.
